H0.text: What is the common term for the practice of freezing a human body in hope of a cure being developed enabling thawing and revival. Cryotherapy

H1.text: What is the common term for the practice of freezing a human body in hope of a cure being developed enabling thawing and revival. Cryopreservation

H2.text: What is the common term for the practice of freezing a human body in hope of a cure being developed enabling thawing and revival. Suspended Animation

H3.text: What is the common term for the practice of freezing a human body in hope of a cure being developed enabling thawing and revival. Cryonic

A4.text: Cryopreservation or cryoconservation is a process where biological material—cells, tissues, or organs—are frozen to preserve the material for an extended period of time.

A5.text: The first human corpse to be frozen with the hope of future resurrection was James Bedford's, a few hours after his cancer-caused death in 1967.
